● Economic drivers: University, healthcare (Forrest General), manufacturing
Employment Landscape:
● Major occupational groups: Office/administrative support (13.5%), sales (11.4%), food
service (10.7%)
● Healthcare sector: 10% of local employment (6,230 jobs)
● Average wage below national average: $22.17 vs. $31.48 nationally
Current Housing Stock Analysis
Rental Market Characteristics:
● Housing costs 23.8% less than national average overall
● Rental options concentrated in $723-$1,479 range
● Limited affordable options below $800 monthly

Reformed Theological Seminary Student Housing Proposal

● Homeownership rate: 37.4% of occupied homes are rented
Geographic Distribution:
● Close proximity to USM campus affects rental pricing
● Midtown area: Higher demand, higher prices
● Suburban areas: Slightly more affordable but transportation challenges
Competition Analysis
Existing Affordable Housing:
● HUD public housing: Limited units with waiting lists
● Low-Income Housing Tax Credit (LIHTC) properties: Available but insufficient supply
● Section 8 vouchers: Long waiting lists, limited availability
Market Gaps:
● Insufficient supply of workforce housing (60-120% AMI range)
● Limited options for young professionals and students
● Few energy-efficient, modern rental options
Development Opportunities:
● Zoning allows multifamily development in targeted areas
● Land availability near USM campus and employment centers
● Local government support for affordable housing initiatives
Regulatory Environment
Zoning and Planning:
● City supportive of workforce housing development
● Opportunities for public-private partnerships
● Tax incentive programs available through state and local levels
